abstract.text: Determine which Apple Music capabilities are available on a customer’s device.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Determining a person’s Apple Music capabilities

inlineContent.text: After you request the user’s permission to access their Apple Music library (see
), you confirm that authorization and then identify Apple Music capabilities on the user’s device.

content.text: Confirm Whether the User Authorized Access to Apple Music Library

inlineContent.text: to check whether the user has authorized access to Apple Music Library. If the authorization status is
to prompt the user for access.
, your app can proceed to determine which Apple Music capabilities (
) are available on the user’s device.

content.text: Create a Cloud Service Controller and Its Handler to Fetch Capabilities

inlineContent.text: method to fetch the current Apple Music capabilities, as described in the sections that follow.

content.text: Check for the Capability to Play Apple Music Content

inlineContent.text: If you want your app to play Apple Music content, check whether

code: // Allows playback of songs in the Apple Music catalog.
// Allows playback of songs in the Apple Music catalog.

inlineContent.text: A user is eligible for an Apple Music subscription offer when
. If you want your app to present the user with an offer to subscribe to Apple Music, check

code: // Allows subscription to the Apple Music catalog.
// Allows subscription to the Apple Music catalog.

inlineContent.text: You can present the offer using

content.text: Check for the Capability to Add Songs to the User’s iCloud Music Library

inlineContent.text: If you want your app to add tracks to the user’s iCloud music library, check whether

code: // Allows songs to be added to the user’s iCloud music library.
// Allows songs to be added to the user’s iCloud music library.

abstract.text: Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
The user authorizes playback of Apple Music tracks and the addition of tracks to their music library.
The authorization type cannot be determined.
Constants that specify the current capabilities of the customer’s Music library on the device.
The device allows tracks to be added to the user’s music library.
The device allows playback of Apple Music catalog tracks.
The device allows subscription to the Apple Music catalog.
An object that determines the current capabilities of a person’s Music library.
Returns the type of authorization the customer has for accessing the Music library on the device.
Asks the customer for permission to access the Music library on the device.
Gets the current capabilities associated with the Music library on the device.
Gets the country code for the storefront associated with a customer’s iTunes account.
Returns a user token that you use to access personalized Apple Music content.
A view controller that helps people perform setup for a cloud service, like an Apple Music subscription.
Prompt the customer to authorize access to Apple Music library.
